tit.e: Byobu nozoki (voyeur at a folding screen)
tit.cmt: 簡潔化（補足訳は後項へ移動）

sen.j: 屏風のぞき（びょうぶのぞき）は、鳥山石燕による妖怪画集『今昔百鬼拾遺』にある日本の妖怪。
sen.e: Byobu nozoki is a Japanese specter drawn in "Konjaku Hyakki Shui" (Ancient and Modern Gleanings of the Hundred Demons), a collection of specters illustrations by Sekien TORIYAMA.

Byobu nozoki (literally, a voyeur at a folding screen) is one of Japanese yokai (specters, monsters, spirits and ghosts) drawn in Sekien TORIYAMA's yokai art collection book "Konjaku Hyakki Shui" (Supplement to The Hundred Demons from the Present and the Past).
sen.cmt: 補足訳追加。なお、voyeurは性的意味合いの強い語ですが、後述のエピソードと符合する為、そのまま採用としました。
sen.e: Byobu nozoki (literally, a voyeur at a folding screen) is one of Japanese yokai (specters, monsters, spirits and ghosts) drawn in Sekien TORIYAMA's yokai art collection book "Konjaku Hyakki Shui" (Supplement to The Hundred Demons from the Present and the Past).

sen.j: 『今昔百鬼拾遺』の解説文によれば、屏風のぞきとは屏風の外側から人を覗き込む妖怪である。
sen.e: According to the caption in "Konjaku Hyakki Shui," byobu nozoki is a specter which peeps in at people from behind byobu (folding screen).

sen.j: 7尺もの屏風の向こうをも覗くとされる。
sen.e: It is said that byobu nozoki can peep over byobu as high as 2.10 m.

sen.j: 中国の古典によると、始皇帝は殺害されかけたときに咸陽宮の屏風を飛び越えたといわれる。
sen.e: According to classical Chinese literature, Shi Huangdi jumped over byobu in Xianyang Palace when he was about to be assassinated.

sen.j: 石燕の解説にある7尺の屏風とはこの咸陽宮の屏風とされる。
sen.e: It is said that 2.10-meter-high byobu in Sekien's caption was the one in Xianyang Palace.

sen.j: このことから、屏風のぞきとは石燕が中国の古典をもとにして描いた創作物との指摘がある。
sen.e: From this some people point out the possibility that Sekien drew byobu nozoki as a creation based on classical Chinese literature.

sen.j: だが一方では、多くの男女の秘め事を見続けてきた寝室の屏風が付喪神になったものが屏風のぞきとの説もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is a theory that byobu nozoki was originally byobu in a bedroom, which had watched many sexual relations, and turned into the artifact spirit.

sen.j: しかしその初夜、布団の中で清左衛門が新妻を抱こうとすると、周りを取り囲む屏風の陰から痩せた女が長い髪を垂らして覗き見ていた。
sen.e: The wedding night, when Seizaemon was going to take his new wife in the bed, there was a skinny woman, with her long hair down, peeping at them from behind byobu around the bed.

sen.e: Seizaemon asked her where she had come from, and she gave her name as 'Nozoki onna' (female voyeur).
